items.text: An example of polymorphic deserialization is if you want your JSON object to deserialize into a java subclass.
items.href: Jackson Polymorphic Deserialization | by David Truong | Medium

items.text: If you have a JSON object for “Vehicle”, it could be a “Car” or “Plane”, each with its own fields, some unique to the other.
items.href: Jackson Polymorphic Deserialization | by David Truong | Medium

items.text: During deserialization, you would want Jackson to deserialize the “Vehicle” JSON object to the appropriate “Car” or “Plane” class.
items.href: Jackson Polymorphic Deserialization | by David Truong | Medium

items.text: We can do that using the @JsonTypeInfo and @JsonSubTypes annotations.
items.href: Jackson Polymorphic Deserialization | by David Truong | Medium

items.text: The @JsonTypeInfo includes a few configuration fields to indicate how Jackson should find the classes to deserialize the JSON to.
items.href: Jackson Polymorphic Deserialization | by David Truong | Medium

items.text: The @JsonSubTypes tells Jackson which classes it should deserialize to.
items.href: Jackson Polymorphic Deserialization | by David Truong | Medium
